revised_title: Radiation from Accelerated Charges: A Study of Electromagnetic Fields
tldr: The author examines the electromagnetic fields generated by an electric point charge moving with acceleration. By applying a limiting process to a special case of acceleration, the author derives the Bondi-Gold solution, which demonstrates how the electromagnetic field tends to zero in certain zones and forms a shock wave in another zone. This solution is shown to be a smooth limit of the Das solution, providing a satisfying explanation for the physical significance of permanent uniform acceleration.
